Reviews.Title: “Good Park and Fly option”
Reviews.Author: Margo H
Reviews.Content: Stayed March 2012 using there Park and Fly package. The Coast offers Continental Breakfast. They are located very close to the airport so don't be surprised if you hear some planes. The extended parking promotion is at Master Park lot C, which must be per booked. It is a good value when needing to leave a car.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable & Quiet but Breakfast poor”
Reviews.Author: WindshearDon
Reviews.Content: We had an early morning flight from SeaTac and chose this place for its proximity and rating. The hotel was older but nicely updated. Very quiet rooms despite being between International Blvd and runway. Everything was fine in the hotel itself. However, the continental breakfast was quite poor. No batter for the waffle iron and no staff evident to fix the problem. Coffee was lukewarm. Bagels yet no jam. Overall the hotel was fine but the included breakfast was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Brief Stay”
Reviews.Author: rhnaks
Reviews.Content: Due to a flight schedule conflict, the airline put us up overnight at the Coast Gateway Hotel. We were pleasantly surprised how clean and comfortable our room was. The free shuttle from/to SeaTac was very convenient and the drivers most courteous. Free breakfast consisting of hard boiled-eggs and self-made waffles were also a nice touch. Also free was HD channels and internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michelle T
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a convention at a nearby hotel, but there rooms were booked. I searched online and found the Coast Gateway, what a pleasure that I did. The hotel provided me a parking voucher which kept additional costs of staying in Sea-Tac down, and the room was very pleasant. Nicest beds I have ever slept in at any hotel. Glad the other hotel was full. I will be returning if I ever stay in Seattle or Sea-Tac again. If I couldn't see the airport I never would have guessed I was staying so close to it. Hotel very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KGDOGD
Reviews.Content: As I drove up to the hotel it hit me that I stayed here before and I did not want to come back. Our Travel agent booked this and I had it in my mind we were staying elsewhere but it worked out okay. The place itself is alright but my major detraction from staying here again is the Park and Fly package requires you to drive offsite to park your vehicle and take the shuttle back OR take the shuttle to the P & F the next morning. For me this was a pain since we had been driving a while to get here and I just wanted to eat dinner and have a beer then go to sleep for our early wake up. This place wont blow you away but it is super close to the airport and the Ale House in the parking lot is rediculously awesome. 50+ beers on tap , great BBQ food and cool bar. 100- 150 feet from the hotel door steps you can stumble back to your room if needed. We even got a $30 voucher to the Ale House by using our agent and the price was very fair.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: TrvlJunkE
Reviews.Content: I got this reservation through bidding for travel on Priceline. I was a bit anxious after reading some of the other reviews for this property but we were very pleasantly surprised. There were five of us staying in two separate rooms. The rooms were very nice, the beds were very comfortable. Looking out our window you could see a terminal at SeaTac but we didn't hear any planes at all. We liked the hotel so much that the next time we were traveling through we stayed at this hotel. They serve a very good continental breakfast that is larger than most. They have a nice pool and a small workout room. The front desk staff, maintenance staff, and housekeeping were all very pleasant and spoke english. :0) Very nice hotel, good price, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: lacamas
Reviews.Content: Convenient location. Breakfast was adequate. Called to request room in quiet part of the hotel and reservations was accommodated and honored it even if booked through Priceline. Was concerned about the security of the parking lot and made sure that there was nothing visible to tempt would be car burglars...so no incident to report. Room was quiet despite proximity to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating”
Reviews.Author: Sue A
Reviews.Content: Got this room for an amazing rate through Priceline, so that we wouldn't have to travel over Snoqualmie Pass in the wee hours. As we left baggage claim at SeaTac at 12:51 a.m., we called the hotel to request the shuttle. The clerk said it would be 10 - 15 minutes, and to wait at Island One. We were at Island One within 3 minutes. We watched and waited and finally called the hotel. The clerk said the driver had been through there and didn't see us! SOOOO!?!?! We were the only couple waiting at Island One; we looked at each and every single shuttle that came through there! And so what if he really did pass through there? (We don't believe he did.) Why didn't he come BACK? Were they really going to just let their registered guests sit there and wait?! In the cold wet wee hours of SeaTac airport? Unbelievable! As for the room - the bed was pretty hard, the shower was good, everything was dated, but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: twilabart
Reviews.Content: We had a layover in Seattle got in late to airport very tired called shuttle service to stay at Hotel, they came and got us and the shuttle driver was so nice, i was so tired and he made us feel so welcome staff was very friendly and the room was clean and nice very close to airport it only took five minutes to get there. cont breakfast and coffee thank you to the hotel for giving us such great service

Reviews.Title: “Great for Early Morning Flights”
Reviews.Author: Seattle_WADonna
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here the night before an early morning flight. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. We asked for an upper floor room so our grandson could watch the airplanes and we were accommodated. Surprisingly, this hotel is very quiet even though it is so close to the airport. You will hear the normal hotel sounds, but not much sound comes in from the outside. The beds in our room were comfortable but small (2 full size beds), however the bottom sheet was just a flat sheet and kept coming undone. There are vending machines on most if not all floors, and a laundry room. We needed an early morning shuttle to the airport at 5:15 and were told shuttles were approximately 15 minutes apart. Perfect! Just enough time for us to grab some yogurt and bagels from the continental breakfast that they open at 5:00AM. There are some restaurants within walking distance, and room service from the onsite restaurant, but we didn't use any of them. All in all, we felt we got a great deal for the price we got through Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: clseyfert
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, inviting and offered everything you could want. The price of the room was very economical. Would definitely recommend this hotel as a place to stay near the airport because it offers shuttle service not only to the airport but to the shopping malls as well. It is also close to the light rail if you want to go downtown. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay for airport connections”
Reviews.Author: polaraubie
Reviews.Content: This is a place I often stay on my way to or from Alaska - late night arrivals and early morning departures. The shuttle service is propmpt and friendly - and the rooms, while basic, serve their purpose well and economically. The cold breakfast buffet is the usual, but adequate - and enough to head out on a flight without meal service. The staff is always friendly and helpful. And the restaurant across the parking lot has good selections at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Best total airport hotel value in the world.”
Reviews.Author: MikeandSarah
Reviews.Content: After 30 years of constant worldwide travel for biz, we now hit the skies for leisure only. About 20-25 times a year our flite leaves early AM so an overnight is required. Sometimes we get back too late to drive and catch the ferry to our island home, so we head here for a night's sleep. Nowhere in the world is there a hotel like this one: neat, clean, up to date; staffed with completely friendly and competent folks, almost all of whom have been there since the day it opened; check in and check out service flawless; very friendly van drivers who whisk customers to the airport every 15 minutes and don't hum and haw for a tip, after they put your bags on and take them off; about 5 minutes away in the van from the airport entrance, sometimes less (you can actually walk to the airport entrance in under 5 minutes); an excellent restaturant 100 feet away from the hotel lobby; adequate biz and fitness rooms; flat panel color TVs and free (really free) internet. And the zinger of all are rates that are at least 50% and generally lower than that charged in all the other big name Seattle airport hotels.Their park and stay combos with MasterPark are incredibly good values. It is a no brainer not to stay here. And this happens every time, every trip.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin.”
Reviews.Author: whicuz
Reviews.Content: You have to understand that I am not used to staying at airport hotels, so my rating is compared to hotels in other locations. For an airport hotel, it was perfectly adequate: they had a cold breakfast with (hot) waffles, clean rooms, a 24-hour on-demand shuttle, and a good location. What more can you ask? It was not luxurious, spacious, updated, etc. I would not recommend it for leisure travelers to Seattle unless they need somewhere to stay for a night before flying out. I have NO specific criticisms: there's nothing WRONG with the hotel, it's just nothing particularly special. The beds were quite comfortable though.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff- great location”
Reviews.Author: RobinSanJose
Reviews.Content: I was just in Seattle for business and needed to have a conference call, access the internet, and I was running out of time. I had stayed at another Coast Hotel the previous night and stopped into this one to see if I could use their internet access and facillities. The staff were extremely friendly and allowed me to do this, which took about an hour. Most hotels will charge for internet and the fact I hadn't even stayed at this hotel makes me really appreciate their hospitality. Very clean too and excellent location next to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Great little airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susan J
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay overnight between flights. I called the hotel for the shuttle, which came within a few minutes. Check-in was prompt, the room was clean, and beds were good (not plush, but good). Staff gave good advice about late-night restaurants in the area. The serve-yourself breakfast was nice -not lavish but quite adequate -waffles, cereal toast, hard-boiled eggs, yogurt, juice, coffee - and it was available starting at 5 am so those of us catching early flights could eat. I would stay here again when passing through Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great for one night”
Reviews.Author: tv40821
Reviews.Content: Rooms small but clean and surprisingly quiet, being so close to the airport. Long-tem parking arrangements were a bit complicated, so we ended up losing money there. Would I stay there again? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced convenience at SeaTac”
Reviews.Author: mikey9
Reviews.Content: Arguably the closest lodging to SeaTac, I was pleasantly surprised by this compact property. I am a veteran user of Hotwire, and pretty good at identifying properties where I have stayed. This was a new one for me, as I tend to stay away from airports and at two star bargain places . This trip was different, as I needed to be near the airport. So although I got this reservation at a booking bargain, the online price is actually fair for the hotel and location. The hotel was clean, as were the rooms. The wireless worked well, the rooms were comfortable (good bed) and very functional. Breakfast is continental but adequate. The exercise room was crowded with equipment but pleasant and usable. There are a number of restaurants walkable, including one right across the parking lot. There is a shuttle to take you to and from the terminal, but if you are not loaded down with stuff, it is a reasonable walk. Coast Gateway is part of chain, and their loyalty program is worth looking into, further lowering your costs. I don't think business is all that wonderful anywhere near Seattle right now (December 2012), so rates may tend to be higher at other times of the year or when (if) the regional economy brightens.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for overnighters!”
Reviews.Author: kennydres
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a great value for the price. It is well located 5 minutes from the airport and is well kept with a very helpful staff. The shuttle is always available to get to the terminal or even to the light rail station for the trip to downtown Seattle. A nice continental breakfast is available, coffee and a refrigerator are in the room, there's plenty of hot water and a great restaurant is next door offering 1/2 price food every day from 5-6. Plus there's free wireless.

Reviews.Title: “very nice housekeepers rude front desk nice drivers”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_vasquezz
Reviews.Content: They do clean every inch of the rooms but some old lady with short blond hair was been rude to here workers nd she was whistling loud and yapping on the phone opening doors with ppl inside Front desk is careless would expect them to be enthusiastic and cheerful bu just dnt care about customers theres one with black hair shes rude and taking her time reading instead the short one speaks little english and theres one with acne all over her face she checked me in a dirty room the housekeepers are great i was on the 6 th floor smoking room and my housekeeper was so helpful and had very good manners and she even said "have a safe flight" when i was walking out over all i would stay here only if i had no were else to go

Reviews.Title: “More Bang for your Buck”
Reviews.Author: WindyRuth
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I shared a room here on October 20th because we were in town for a continuing education training. Immediately upon check-in, I felt like I had walked into a relative's large home. The maintenance man and the front desk clerk were very friendly and accommodating. In fact, when we realized that you don't get a view of the airport concourses from the second floor, we went back and asked for a room on one of the upper floors. It was no problem at all and the request was answered with a yes and a smile. The rooms here are probably the most sound-proof rooms I have ever stayed in. There were all the perks of viewing the jets taking off with none of the noise. The shower had great pressure, the towels were plush and the shower door/bathtub combo worked for me. There is a sink with the mirror outside the bathroom so one of us could put on make-up while the other one was showering. We were on a smoking floor but our room did not smell like smoke (fortunately) and proved that the rooms are airtight as well. The breakfast service was much like you'd get at a Holiday Inn Express--very good and filling. I would definitely stay here again. Friendly service, free parking, free internet

Reviews.Title: “Close stay to airport if you have an early flight!”
Reviews.Author: jillpikkle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we had a 6am international flight. The room was clean and quiet. Check-in was easy and the shuttle is available 24 hours. The room comes complete with refrigerator and flat screen tvs. Good place if you just need a place to crash for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mikeandmickey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights over a two week period during a trip from Maine. We were so impressed the first night that we made plans to stay there again at different times over the next two weeks when we were going to be in and out of Seattle. The rooms were VERY clean,and that is important to us. The staff were polite, accomodating, professional and very helpful. We would stay there again without any concerns. They offer 24 hour shuttle service and we found it to be prompt (a 4:30 am call) and courtious. They have a guest office where we could print boarding passes for the airport at no charge. This is easily one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. I recommend this to anyone going to the Seattle area, family or working trip. Excellent continental breakfast as well. I have never writtena review before but was so impressed with the Coast Gateway I felt I had to. They were great!

Reviews.Title: “Normally a good business stop”
Reviews.Author: Winezperce
Reviews.Content: I have used the Coast Gateway Hotel near the Sea-Tac Airport for many years as a arrival and departure hotel and for a couple of meetings. Generally it is a decent place to stay. Rooms are clean but small, very convenient location. I have only had one bad night here and that was because of an extremely loud individual next door and his buddy who had a women there for awhile and played loud music and were very loud themselves. They slammed doors non-stop. I complained to the front desk twice and though they called the room asking them to keep it down the noise was louder, including the door being intentionally slammed very hard after the 2nd call from the front desk. The noise was from 230 to 530am when the individual finally went to sleep. The hotel did not offer me any compensation or change of rooms for a loss of a nights sleep. I stay here 16 nights a year and would have expected better treatment. The front desk is pretty lethargic and not very helpful at times. They take a hold on your credit card for incidentals even though there is no bar, restaurant or services in the hotel which I find irritating. Parking is sometimes very difficult because the hotel shares a parking lot with a busy BBQ place next door and I believe some people park there who have taken flights. Beds are comfortable and when quiet I have always rested well here. Several good places to eat within walking distance. And you can't get any closer to the airport than here.

Reviews.Title: “ok, good place to eat next door”
Reviews.Author: Liz99362
Reviews.Content: The room was ok, fine to stay here if you are making a quick trip in and out, wouldn't want to stay more than 1 night though. price is really good, the lobby smells smokey. Location is close enought to walk to the airport, but they do have a shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service”
Reviews.Author: 821amr
Reviews.Content: Close enough to SEATAC Airport to walk, though shuttle service is convenient and accommodating. Rooms are all you need, clean and well-appointed, but what makes this hotel stand out is the helpful and friendly staff. I was impressed by how they are willing to go the extra mile with a smile. I will definitely make this my overnighter-at-SEATAC hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Atl30309
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Hotwire and couldn't have been happier. As this hotel backs up to Concourse A of the airport, I thought it would be great to have a room facing the airport. Upon checkin I requested an airport side room and was gioven one on the top floor overlooking the activities of SeaTac. The hotel was clean, the check in andcheck out process was smooth and pleasant and the modest breakfast was just enough to start the day. Overall, it was a great stay in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “In SeaTac?? Hop over the fence of the Airport and stay here”
Reviews.Author: Raquels31
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel via Top Secret hotels with Travelocity. Nothing to write home about, however very clean, spacious and comfortable. Can literally see runways from window however no airport noise. Within a 5-10 minute walk of Seattle's Rapid Transit rail and another 20 mins to downtown. Great way to avoid higher priced downtown hotels. The waffles at this hotel along with the rest of the free breakfast were great! And FREE Wi-Fi!

Reviews.Title: “Available in August and who needs downtown anyway?”
Reviews.Author: mcahill6912
Reviews.Content: The Coast Gateway Hotel is a comfortable hotel located just minutes from Seatac Airport. The rooms look newly renovated with new flat screen televisions. In a standard room there is a queen bed. There are also rooms with two doubles or kings. The queen was comfortable and the sheets were thick and soft. The sink is outside the bathroom and the bathroom itself contains a full tub behind a glass shower door. They serve a complimentary breakfast but there is a Dennyâ€™s and Daveâ€™s Diner within a block of two of the hotel. Definitely try Dave's. A taxi to downtown Seattle is about $50.00 but the light rail to downtown is just 6 blocks away and it only costs $2.75 for the 38 minute trip to Westlake Terminal. The taxi takes 20 to 25 minutes so there is no time lost on the light rail. Because this hotel is outside of downtown you can still get rooms in the popular summer months and for half the price. Your mileage may vary.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean, and convenient to the airport, with a 5:00 a.m. free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: travelerduo
Reviews.Content: From the courtesy phones in the Hotel Transportation area of the airport, press #45 to get the free shuttle for the Coast Gateway Hotel. The shuttle came within 10 minutes. My plane was to leave at 7:00 a.m., so I was grateful for the 5:00 a.m. complimentary breakfast offered by the hotel. It included toast, bagels, apples, bananas, waffles from a waffle iron, boiled eggs, yogurt, juice, coffee, and other things I'm forgetting. Check-in was fast, and my room was located just off the elevator, which was convenient. At the Hilton, I've had to walk and walk and walk to get to my room, which was no fun pulling heavy bags.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: laurie1958
Reviews.Content: Girl at the front desk was very accommodating and really helpful. I didn't have to ask for a king bed she took one look at my 6'4" husband and automatically gave us a king bed. The night cost us $178 for the hotel and to leave our truck for 7 days at a secured parking garage. We drove our new truck to the parking garage and they took us to the airport. When we arrived at the airport we called them so that they would have our truck ready for us and they picked us up and brought us back to our truck which was waiting for us and in excellent condition. Glad we chose this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: ktdipaula
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was close to the airport & it was clean. It delivered on both. Not too much else to say, continental breakfast was decent. I would stay here again if I needed to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid experience!”
Reviews.Author: JapanKris
Reviews.Content: Alaska airlines put me up in this hotel after a delay caused me to miss my connection in Seattle. The room was basic, but clean, felt like I was transported back to the 80's with the decor (even the lamps were glued to the nighstand). The night staff was courteous and helpful, check in was quick and she pointed out walkable restaurants. But, after going to bed at 7am, I was rudely awoken by very loud DRILLING in the room next door at 10:45! Check out is not until noon! After calling the front desk she replied "you are checking out today anyways" so rude and not helpful! And the drilling continued!!! I would not recommend this hotel at all to anyone due to the rudeness of the morning front desk. Airline comp or no comp!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, safe choice near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Redthatch
Reviews.Content: Very close to SeaTac airport, but rooms are quiet. Rooms not large but clean and comfortable. Microwave, mini-fridge, hairdryer. Small fitness room. Free breakfast, but pretty limited selection. Convenient parking if needed. Free shuttle from airport. We stayed two nights in July 2011. Convenient and comfortable but not lavish.

Reviews.Title: “Great value !”
Reviews.Author: NVladybug
Reviews.Content: Stayed night before our flight and then on the way back again. Clean rooms, nice complimentary breakfast (kids loved the waffles), efficient front desk and timely/very friendly shuttle service to the airport. Would definitely stay again. Everything you need from an airport hotel. Pleasant surprise :)

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the snobs, its a nice place!”
Reviews.Author: traveling_monster_me
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the previous reviews, I was concerned this hotel would be low-rent and not a 4-star as they claim. I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel, staff and room were very nice and the free shuttle from the airport was prompt. The location is almost AT the airport, but I did not hear any planes. The free breakfast was a little weak, but hey, its free! There are also several places to eat within a block, including Denny's, IHop, Subway and a BBQ place. I would certainly return to this hotel. Do yourself a favor and use Priceline. Bid 1/2 the price and get all the perks. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: fact51
Reviews.Content: one the 4th floor facing the runway right next to the elevator . Very quiet. Firma beds and very clean. I was expecting mucho worse but nice place. Good breakfast. Gets crowded though. Front desk not very attentive . Parking good. very close to main terminal entrance . It got it for 80 .00 on priceline which was high.If you get it for less go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough.....”
Reviews.Author: TravelForFunDeerPark
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. We got the hotel thru a priceline bid. Not as nice as some of the three star hotels in the area, but nice enough. Shuttle service was excellent. Breakfast was quite adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a night”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia180
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very basic, good for a night if you can get a cheap rate. The staff is really pleasant (although the shuttle driver mistakenly gave my suitcase to someone else at the airport and had to run them down to get it back). It's conveniently located within a few steps of places to eat. Could really use some updating in the rooms; just make it seem like I'm not stepping back a century...

Reviews.Title: “good value - nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: teasixfan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night in April 2011. We flew into Seattle late and just needed a place to stay for the night and we got the Coast Gateway hotel on priceline for $40/night. ($53 including tax) We were expecting worse from the reviews, so we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is located 5 minutes from the SEA airport. Complimentary parking, but the spaces are very narrow. Check in only took 3 minutes. Our room was pretty spacious with a queen sized bed and chair, also a desk and tv area. The sheets were what I would expect from a 3 star hotel with one of those tacky coverlets. The decor and amenities weren't exactly luxurious, but everything was clean and fit for one night's stay. There was a microwave & also a mini fridge, and the hotel provided coffee and tea bags. I thought the bathroom only had a walk in shower, but it actually had a tub as well. I didn't try the breakfast, but my husband said it was decent. For the price, this was a decent hotel to stay at that offered free parking and free breakfast. (breakfast is from 6am-10am) I might come back again if I need a place for a short stay, but I would definitely not pay full price for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “POOR VEHICLE SECURITY”
Reviews.Author: UNHAPPY3476
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in April 2011 and had booked through Hotwire. On the website we chose a three star hotel, unfortunately we got Coast Gateway hotel. This hotel is older and the staff is not very helpful. We were not impressed upon arrival but chose to stay the night. Our truck was broken into and personal belongings were taken and the staff didn't care at all. They simply said call the police, no sorry, they didn't even offer the phone to call the police. After to speaking to staff at a nearby restaurant I was told the area is not safe and vehicles get broken into often. The hotel has no securtiy and no video cameras outside. The staff being so cold and uncaring made the situation much worse. I would never book this hotel and I would be careful when booking on Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Poor choice of hotels”
Reviews.Author: Blueowlbc
Reviews.Content: We booked is hotel through price line and while we did not select it, figured it would be the one we got from bidding websites. I travelled western Canada for 7 years and the Coast chain was my hotel of choice. They use to run a program were if you stayed 12 times in the winter months you got a really nice gift. Well I got 4 of them and missed the by one stay in 2 other years. I mention this because they were a good chain. The same cannot be said about coast gateway, as I no longer travel, I cannot comment on the whole chain, but this place was a disappointment. We arrived in seattle after 6 hour flight at 10:30pm and went to the hotel. The girl at e front desk was not rude but not exactly friendly. She gave us a room on the 2nd floor and I knew we were in trouble when the room was right across from the elevator. We opened the door and were greeted with cheap perfume flower smell, that was very strong (suspect it was to mask what might have been old smoking room). We then rounded the small wall to witness the smallest hotel room in America. It contained a 1 double bed and two wooden chairs. We looked and immediately new two grown adults could not sleep comfortably in the bed. I went to the front desk and was informed no other rooms were available, unless we wanted active smoking rooms. The girl was of no help and referenced the fact we were on a price line deal. Clearly they could have had a better room for us given we booked one min earlier and we witnessed at least 5 other parties checking in with airline vouchers, because they missed connecting flights. In the end they would do nothing for us and because of e flower smell and bed size we could not stay and left within 30 minutes Both the hotel and price line are refusing to give back our money and insist that they supplied a 3 star hotel. I am now fighting them with a MasterCard dispute. It is a shame they put customers through this, when the client finds te room so bad that they could not stay. I strongly recommend staying away from is and all Coast hotels, clearly they have become a low end chain. Motel 6 would be a much better choice .

Reviews.Title: “Coast Gateway a pleasant stay close by SEA-TAC airport”
Reviews.Author: panda88
Reviews.Content: We got this place through a Priceline bid USD 45 plus taxes, overnight for an Amtrak train the next morning. Comfortable bed, mini-fridge, microwave, free wi-fi, breakfast included with make it yourself Belgin waffles, hard boiled eggs, cold and hot cereals, bagels, juices, coffee, tea. Airport shuttle available. Denny's restaurant five minute walk. SoundTransit Light Rail about a twenty minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and convenience”
Reviews.Author: RanyDanny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coast Gateway as the first step in our trip to Europe. The hotel claims to be the closest to SeaTac. It couldn't be more accurate. From our window we could physically see Terminal A across the street! But it was surprisingly quiet. It took us less than 2 minutes to reach the terminal! Some areas of the hotel look a bit old. The bathroom in our suite was also on the older side but it was clean. The toilette area closes with a sliding door, something I've never seen in any other hotel. Use of Internet in the business center is free and you can check and print your itinerary, boarding pass, driving directions, etc. Breakfast was included and it was actually very decent. The shuttle took us to the terminal on demand (no need to wait for a scheduled shuttle) and the driver was very courteous. The oddest things was the front desk: we arrive to the hotel at 9 pm, then went down to the business center at 11 pm and the we came down for breakfast and checkout around 10 am. The same lonely lady was always there! She was pulling a 12+ hours shift... It was a good experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: momona808
Reviews.Content: I flew in late and had to stay in Seatac area for one night. I got this hotel on one of this bidding sites and got it so cheap, I freaked myself out! But the shuttle pick up was prompt and driver was informative about places to eat. Room was clean and had much more amenities than I expected. Breakfast was simple but filling and everyone was helpful and polite. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but certainly nothing to rave about.”
Reviews.Author: memjfm1
Reviews.Content: The room didnâ€™t have a closet but rather a hutch for hanging close. My wife and I checked in about 4:00PM and, although the hotel was largely empty at that time, were given a 2nd floor room overlooking the entrance way below vice a quieter room on the back side. Further we were clearly told the room rate was $80 plus tax but the less-than engaged desk clerk but when I checked the bank statement on line after returning home, I note the base rate was $89.00. I have no real recourse to protest this but to post here. Get confirmation of the rate as the desk lady flat out misrepresented the cost. The included breakfast was good and fairly complete as such included breakfasts go. The size of the hutch precludes moving the desk chair to a better vantage to watch television.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: IdrivealotMaine
Reviews.Content: I was put up in this hotel by the airlines after volunteering my seat to another traveler. I was very impressed. The hotel was great. There were many restaurants nearby. A person can easily walk there from the airport. I enjoyed it very much. The only downside is that guests have to pay for the internet.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills, decent breakfast layout, good commuter hotel”
Reviews.Author: BostonIndian
Reviews.Content: How you feel about this hotel depends on what you are doing in the area. I had a flight reaching Seattle at 11:55pm, so this was where I was going to crash for the night and then drive to Olympic the next day. With that in context: The breakfast spread is decent... not over the top, but sufficient and balanced between carbs and protein. I asked (and got) a room on the upper levels in the back of the hotel. The view is nothing to write home about (it is close to the Airport after all), but the rooms are surprisingly quiet. It's a bit of a drive to Seattle and back, so using this hotel as the base for a Seattle trip is not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “was surprised, great deal....”
Reviews.Author: reese1
Reviews.Content: I booked a room on hotwire, $54+ taxes, $66 total for one night, last night, flight was 6am this morning. I stayed at the Coast in Bellvue which is a DUMP so I was expecting the same and was surprised.... this hotel was definitely a good deal, stayed in room #614, it was clean, bathroom was spotless, front desk staff very, very helpful, courtesy ride to the airport on time and the driver was a nice/funny guy. Complimentary breakfast/coffee starts are 5am. Definitely would recommend this hotel to people needing a room near the airport...also the Roasters Restaurant next door is decent with 26 beers on tap and chicken/mashed potatoes that was good.

Reviews.Title: “Old, has no amenities and worst customer service at front desk”
Reviews.Author: Traveller499115
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel twice, not by choice, but through Priceline. Although there is free parking and complimentary continental breakfast in the morning, there are no amenities whatsoever (well, there is a room with a computer in it if you wish). Housekeeping was not available past 4pm, all dishes used in this hotel are styrofoam or plastic (which you can't use in the microwave), and asking for assistance at the front desk is useless. The clerks speak to you as though you are bothering them and some of them have no customer service skills at all. They treat guests as though they are a nuisance and go out of their way to make you feel unwelcome. When we explained our dissatisfaction at the service we were given they told us they could help us get a room elsewhere but would have to pay for that one "as well as theirs". They don't care about being helpful and the word friendly is not part of their vocabulary. The rooms are adequate, as clean as the look of the 1980's can be, but this is more of a truck-stop hotel than a place you can enjoy with your family. Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “Effective & Efficient 4 the price”
Reviews.Author: luckymanagain
Reviews.Content: Nothing wrong with this place if u just need a place to crash before your flight. 8 bucks for Internet. Restaurant next door, sharps roaster and ale house is super friendly and has great food & bar. No cost for parking at hotel. Easy walk to 13 coins.

Reviews.Title: “good value with smoking rooms”
Reviews.Author: travels_on_belly
Reviews.Content: not the most impressive hotel, this is a good place for business travelers or someone who just needs a room close to the airport. we just needed a place to sleep before and after our hiking trip to rainier. front desk was helpful. and i think i got the last smoking room in seattle. woo!

Reviews.Title: “Overall OK place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: lala1330
Reviews.Content: We checked in very late at night. Called for a shuttle pick up multiple times and kept on being told to call back when I got to certain other areas. Shuttle was very busy because it will take you other places besides the airport/hotel. Shuttle driver was very nice. Hotel front desk person was quick and nice. Room was clean and good. I asked in advance about the free WiFi and was told it was free, not true. In the room the card will tell you it is free to get you to the ATT page that will charge you per hour or daily. I was very unhappy about that surprise. The breakfast in the morning was a disappointment too. We left at six am and there was no waffle machine that worked, boiled eggs were not good, stale toast and very sour juices. I was glad I had not planned for that to be part of my deal about why I chose this hotel. Overall, if your here for a quick nights sleep it is a good cheap hotel. If your hungry there is a Denny's and Jack N the Box next door.

Reviews.Title: “Best location of all SEA-TAC airport hotels”
Reviews.Author: efsch
Reviews.Content: The Coast Gateway Hotel is just a 5 minute walk (no streets crossed) to/from SEA-TAC airport terminal building. The rooms are quiet and pleasant (including a fridge and microwave and a window that opens); the included buffet continental breakfast offers a good variety of choices from 5am daily; and the staff is friendly. I did not use the business center and do not know about parking for this hotel, but the light rail now serves the airport to/from downtown ($2.50 each way, machines accept credit cards but can be hard to find at downtown stations and the transit police are nasty). The light rail station is in the NE corner of the airport parking structure. The hotel is on International Blvd at the SE corner of the airport. There are several hotels and restaurants nearby (the Doubletree Hotel, which I also like but is not quite as convenient due to its larger size, is across the street). This hotel participates with Pricline.com bidding and can be a great bargain if you know how to bid (see biddingfortravel for pointers).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hekkl5
Reviews.Content: nice- friendly people- great beds- clean- quiet - convienient- book it, you won't be sorry. This was our stay before before our cruise and it couldn't have been better. You can walk it from the airport, but they have a free shuttle. Call and they'll be there in minutes. skip the expensive steakhouse next door, walk down the block to Denny's.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: WendyWal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are pretty picky about hotels. For $89 a night, this is the most reasonable hotel near the airport that's clean and fine. The windows open, which I like, and there's a complimentary breakfast and shuttle. The airport is very close and actually walkable. It's not as modern as the Radisson, but is $50 less a night. Help is very good too, as is the restaurant , Sharps, right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in an Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MFRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: I just finished a two day stay in one of the rooms facing towards the airport, and overall found the property to be a good value. The hotel is on par with a HI Express or a Hampton Inn; Iâ€™d say a little bit closer to the Hampton Inn type of layout. The place is fairly new, rooms were clean and overall the furnishings were nice. I used the gym, it had very new Lifefitness equipment, the down side was it was very crowded due to having a treadmill, a cycle, and elliptical, and a weight machine & weight set & bench all crammed into a standard room converted to a gym. Internet hook up is a charge, but you can use the business center for free. This hotel is walking distance from the airport, you walk straight out of the terminal & turn to the right and it is down about one block. About a 5 min walk total. Early check in was not a problem. Rooms were very quiet, and it even had functioning windows. With the clean air of Seattle, thatâ€™s a big plus. I suggest a street side room if you are a very light sleeper. (Trash truck shows up at 4AM which was louder than any aircraft noise) And they will give you Alaska Airlines points. Food in the area is close & walking distance, (About 2-3 block) Sharps in the parking lot of the hotel is very good, and if you walk down past the Dennyâ€™s to the south, Daveâ€™s Diner has a far better breakfast for about the same price as a Dennyâ€™s. And 13 Coins is across from the airport entrance in a large hi-rise up one block if you want a steak house. Talking to someone else during my visit the Doubletree across the street was very close in price but hits you with add on fees for parking, etc. and there is a really nice Radisson & Hilton in the same area. Overall not a bad place at the rate I had.

Reviews.Title: “Great small airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cinderella_gal
Reviews.Content: The Coast Gateway is a terrific small airport hotel, perfect for value-conscious travelers. We've stayed here several times when overnighting in Seattle between flights. The hotel is basic, but rooms are more than adequate, although not large, with an armoire for hanging up clothes rather than a separate closet. A very nice continental breakfast is included in the price, and also complimentary internet in their business center. The airport shuttle is convenient, but you do have to put your luggage on the bellman's cart and take it up to your room yourself, which we found to be no problem. While there is no restaurant actually in the hotel, a very nice BBQ/roaster/bar is conveniently located just across the parking lot. (I believe some area restaurants may deliver to the hotel also.) One additional service that we really appreciate is complimentary transportation to Southcenter Mall (a large shopping center), about 10 minutes away that is provided by a shuttle service that the Gateway contracts with. All in all, if you're looking for a clean, convenient airport hotel in Seattle, this will defintely fit the bill..

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant odor”
Reviews.Author: Flight_815
Reviews.Content: My flight was so delayed that I got in too late to drive the 100 miles home, so the airline put me up here. I got a room on the 3rd floor facing the parking lot, over the entry. It was nearly 2am. I asked for a fan because I like to sleep with white noise. The desk clerk said they didn't have any. The room smelled very musty, so I opened the window, which was behind a heavy curtain. If the curtain was open there were very bright lights right outside. It was 34 degrees out so it was too cold to leave open, and then I could also hear the sirens. I tried to turn the air conditioning/heater onto "fan" only and the nob was broken. So I put it on heat but turned it on "cooler". The smell seemed to be coming from the air unit, and the hallway smelled the same and it was so late I didn't ask for another room, but wonder if anyone else on here noticed the odor. Also there was a hair under the toilet wrap. Breakfast was dry oranges and hard boiled eggs with invisible shell fragments and orange juice. I think I was already getting sick but had the runs by the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Good for airport.”
Reviews.Author: ejpiii
Reviews.Content: I was put here after being voluntarily bumped off a flight. For an airport hotel, this is all you need. It can't be 5 minutes from the courtesy bus pick up to the hotel door. The service was fast, its next door to a Denny's and a place that does their catering, the gym is cramped, but adequate. The only thing I could've wished for is a hot tub and pool to relax in.

Reviews.Title: “close to airport”
Reviews.Author: cmnipomo
Reviews.Content: We stayed when arriving & again prior to an early flight on our departure. The first night was adequate & room was clean- just skimpy on towels (and I agree about the shower configuration- knocked the skin off my knee trying to get out) On our return, they checked in another guest under my name. The first clerk said I had to have my confirmation number & I explained we were there 2 days before and I had arranged for a late check. She said she had no rooms! She was accusatory & acted as if I wasn't being honest (yep, that angered me!) The second clerk then came over & said she had double booked another room & had to go verify that no one was in it. We finally got a room & asked for a wake-up call (did not get it). Overall, room is fine, noise not bothersome, continental breakfast better than most & price is fair. We would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay budget choice in a pinch”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelVA
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this hotel for one night when our flight was canceled. We were put there by the airline which paid for the stay. The good part is that it's close to the airport with a 24 hour shuttle. There's also continental breakfast, but we didn't eat there. Nothing special about the hotel - definitely a budget option without any extras - checked in at 2 AM and had to check out by 11 AM (no way to extend checkout). I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worked well for us”
Reviews.Author: Juandah
Reviews.Content: Like most travellers who use this hotel, we had an overnight stay before an early morning flight the next day. We used the free shuttle service from the airport, which took a while to come, but only because of the congestion in the pick up zones. We had a room overlooking the airport - an absorbing view. The hotel is so well soundproofed that we were not disturbed by noise at all, from inside or outside.The room was more than comfortable, very clean, nicely decorated. Check in went very smoothly, and all our dealings with the staff were of a high standard. The person on the reception counter was able to attend to the needs of a number of guests simultaneously - she was obviously very skilled and exceedingly pleasant. We had no problems accessing the business room for internet access, and all our enquiries were handled well. A self-serve continental breakfast was available from very early and the range of choices was good - from fresh waffles, cereals, fruit, toast, eggs etc. We were close enough to walk to the airport the next morning, even though we could have used the free shuttle. It took about five minutes to walk, pulling our bags. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel - it was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience!”
Reviews.Author: jchunturano
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a weekday in a superior room (at AAA rate). Bed was very comfortable, bath was clean, towels & robes thick, refrigerator. Overall, very clean and well maintained room. Hotel borders the runway, but with soudproofing the airport traffic wasn't a bother at all--actually pretty neat to have a front row view of gates A13 & A14! Front desk staff was friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: aneczka
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, great staff, nice clean rooms. It is located right by the airport therefore the windows are made to cancel out the noise but if you open the window you do hear the noise from the airport but it did not bother me at all. The best thing about this hotel aside from its appearance is the breakfast as they have the best Belgian waffles I've ever ate, delicious :) Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: anod1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Coast Gateway hotel from Feb4-8 08, while in Seatac for Business. The hotel is in Seatac, about two minutes from the Airport and not really in Seattle. Being close to the airport was a plus, but if the noise of planes bothers you, you may want to move down the road a little. My room was facing the street and you couldn't really hear the planes, but I bet it would be a little louder if you were tarmac side. Just a heads up. The hotel was clean and comfortable. No real frills, but not dumpy at all either. The staff was very friendlly. The continental breakfast was nice, but they don't change it up. So after a couple of days it got rather boring. I would recommend this hotel for a short stay and I'd consider staying here again if ever in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Constantly impressed, time after time!!!”
Reviews.Author: nwkauaiboy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Coast Gateway Seattle well over 2 dozen times since 2002 and have yet to be disappointed. We have found the staff to be friendly, accommodating and most helpful with special requests. With 4 children we must book 2 rooms to accommodate all the bodies and often stay on both ends of our flights (or Mariner games) just to get in a few extra moments of pampering. We cannot say enough about the kindness shown the children and ourselves. The desk staff are quick at check-in/out and room service from the Sharps Roaster Ale House next door is always prompt. The beds are comfortable and the airport "noise" is practically non-existent. While the bathrooms themselves are on the small side, it functions for the intended purpose. The rooms are spacious, and when staying on the airport side the upper floors offer terrific views of the airport and hours of viewing pleasure if you like to people watch. The bathroom amenities are generous and the bath linens are satisfactory. The morning complimentary breakfast offers fresh made waffles w/ your choice of toppings, yogurt, various breads & bagels, hard-boiled eggs, oatmeal, coffee, tea, a variety of juice options, milk, hot chocolate, apple cider and three choices of cereal. We always walk away more than satisfied and the children look forward to breakfast before flying out. The business center is well supplied and complimentary. Access is controlled by the front desk so there are no children in the way when you need to print tickets or check email. Computers are up to date. Although a pool/ spa would be a nice addition, they offer a small fitness room that has limited equipment that is adequate to get a decent workout. The property offers airport shuttle service and while we have never waited more than 10 minutes to get the shuttle, we have begun to walk to and from the airport just to stretch our legs a little more. The airport doors are only a 7 minute walk away so the location is excellent for a little pre-flight fresh air. The Park and Fly lot is located at Masterpark Lot C, about 1mile north from the property. While it is a little bit of a hassle, the security and service of Masterpark is excellent and well worth the extra time and energy. We will continue to use the Coast Gateway as our primary Seattle area hotel. While we have on occasion stayed at other properties in Seattle, The Coast Gateway is the our preferred option and we have recommended this property to dozens of our family and friends and no one has been disappointed with many returning anytime they travel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: 01Julie
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems nice when you walk in but the rooms were very tired. The drapes didn't close properly, the popcorn ceilings seemed dirty and a tiny bathroom with a single shower door installed over a tub which receded into a wall making it a very claustrophobic design. The worst though was the cheap lumpy pillows and the turquiose blanket, time to update! The dishwater coffee at breakfast was just horrible and breakfast consisted mainly of white carbohydrates, why not have a bran muffin or whole wheat bread. Also our floor smelled like cigarette smoke even though it was suppose to be a non-smoking floor. Also the garbage bins were emptied at 6 am, not a nice way to wake up. There are lots of hotels around Sea Tac; my opinon is try another one.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Stay at any Other Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: forksbear
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times now, the most recent stay on September 6th. You can't beat this hotel for convenience, cleanliness, and service. I liked my first stay so much that I became a Coast Rewards member on the spot, and each night I stay I earn 500 Alaska Air miles. I did learn to ask for a room that doesn't have a connecting door (you never know if the person in the next room snores or tends to talk loud on the phone at 3 a.m.) and that makes all the difference in the world - quiet and relaxing. Of course, this is true for most hotels, never get a room with a connecting door, always ask. The rooms are clean, furniture and bedding in excellent repair, the wireless high-speed Internet access in each room is amazingly fast, there is a mini fridge and microwave, as well as a coffee maker with an ample supply of coffee, etc., and the bathroom is well lit and comfortable with all the items one would need while traveling. You can either have a room facing International Blvd or the airport. On the airport side you would never know you were within walking distance of the jumbo jets unless you looked out the window, good soundproofing. The airport shuttle, I believe, runs about ever 15 minutes or you can go to the front desk and let them know you need the shuttle and they will radio the driver to alert him or her that a guest is waiting. I've never had a problem with this, and the drivers always help me with my bags and are friendly and knowledgeable of the airport - just tell them where you need to go at Seatac and they will make sure you are dropped off as close to the area you need to be as they can get you. During my last visit I needed to catch the Kenmore Air shuttle to Boeing Field to fly to Port Angeles (I live on the Olympic Peninsula) and the shuttle driver drove me right to the pickup spot where the shuttle would be arriving a few minutes later. The front desk staff are courteous, friendly, and very helpful. During my last stay I had arrived on the spur of the moment without a reservation and they had me in their computer system as a Coast Rewards member with my preferences, etc., and quickly checked me in, literally within 2 minutes flat. Non-connecting room, in the corner like I prefer, facing International Blvd. You can't beat that type of service, and they do it with a smile! The room service at this hotel is EXCELLENT. The restaurant next door, Sharp's Roaster & Ale House, provides room service from 11 to 10 PM on weekdays and noon to 10 PM on weekends. They make the best house salad I've ever had, absolutely HUGE for a reasonable price, and it is a complete meal in itself. Their staff is just as friendly and helpful at the Coast Gateway staff, and as a habit when I stay at Coast Gateway I'm on the phone to room service ordering my salad for dinner. All in all, this is the best place to stay at if you need a flight in the morning or have a layover.

Reviews.Title: “Nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Akoperagirl
Reviews.Content: In spite of being very close to the airport (walking distance) my room was very quiet. Staff were pleasant and efficient, the room comfortable and clean, the pick up shuttle prompt. Canâ€™t talk about breakfast because I had to leave before it was served (it starts at 5am). They have a great rate for Alaskans (Seattle is our hub to the outside world). I have stayed here several times and will do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel - great staff”
Reviews.Author: dogsareforlife
Reviews.Content: This is a great little aiport hotel. Infact its so close if you don't have luggage you could easily walk it - but the shuttle turned up quickly once called. Had we known the area we would have walked to it with our cases after a 9 hour flight - it really is that close. Check in was friendly and welcoming - all the details were just as booked. The room, on the 5th floor, was overlooking the airport but there was no distrubing noise - this is a very quiet hotel. The room was large, well appointed and exceptionally clean. Bathroom was well lit and had everything you needed - no complaints. Breakfast in the morning was very sugary - cereals and danish etc - but good coffee was available and it was served in a small area off reception. I'd recommend this hotel for a quick stay over to anyone. We paid $135 and I think this was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tess69
Reviews.Content: We were in Seattle for only one night and flew in from South Texas. We wanted a nice hotel near the airport, as we knew we would be in airports all day. Our husband's rode into Seattle on Harley's and we met them at the hotel. Being that we had never been to Seattle, we figured it would be easy for them to find the hotel and for us not to have too long of a taxi ride. The hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful. The rooms were very clean and spacious. Large shower was nice. We had a view of the airport and never found it to be too noisy. The only downfall for this hotel was it's location from downtown. We were told by many locals that if you are in Seattle for only one day, you have to see the Space Needle and Pikes Street Market. The taxi ride from the hotel to downtown was anywhere from $ 30 - $ 40 each way. Being that we made one trip to downtown that evening (Space Needle) and the next morning (Pike Street Market), we spent alot on cab fares. However, if you need a nice hotel near the airport, with no airport noise, this is a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Continental Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: dillydally77
Reviews.Content: GOOD: A suprisingly good continental breakfast was served each morning including a make-it-yourself waffle station and hard-boiled eggs. Furthermore, the rooms were clean and spacious with free HBO. And front staff were helpful with all our questions. BAD: Located right beside the airport so it was occasionally loud. Planes could be seen taxing just outside the room window. The housekeeper knocked on our door to clean the room awfully early in the morning 8AM!! We were still in bed then. I suggest putting the Do Not Disturb sign on the door before you go to bed if you plan on sleeping past 8am. All in all, the hotel was approximately a 10-15min drive from downtown Seattle. But if you don't plan on staying predominantly in the downtown core then the location is great for visiting the Museum of Flight (highly recommended) or Boeing etc... This hotel is good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel For The Money”
Reviews.Author: garner
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on our lst night in Seattle. Clean spacious bedrooms, friendly reception staff, very good complimentary breakfast. Great location 2 mins from the Airport. All in all a hotel that I can recommend. Give it a try you will not be disappoijnted.

Reviews.Title: “Cleaning the rooms a bit too early ??”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, fabulous breakfast !! Waffles you make fresh,cereal,fruit,yogurt,coffee,tea,toast, etc. but unfortunately at 8:05 (and I was sleeping in that a.m. because I was flying out from Seatac airport which is just minutes away) they were vacuuming right down the hall and you couldn't sleep through it. I asked about this when I checked out and suggested they clean the rooms and hold off on vacuuming until 10 am or so, you can't check in before then, but they didn't think this was an issue. Oh well, won't stay there again if ever flying out of Seattle Tacoma International Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: YVRTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for an overnight in order to catch a early morning flight out of Sea-Tac. This facility is comparable to other Coast properties that I have stayed in throughout British Columbia. Location is perfect. Less than 2 minutes and you are in the Seatac airport parking garage. If you are plane buff, ask for an odd number room so that you can overlook the airport. Our room was so close to the A concourse of Sea-Tac that one could easily see travellers waiting for their flights at gate A-14. The hotel offers a complimentary continental breakfast which was quite limited. If you wish a meal outside of breakfast, that means eating outside of the hotel. Across the hotel's parking lot is Sharp's Roaster & Ale House; good food. Actually this restaurant provides the room service for the Coast. Check-in and check-out was prompt, friendly and efficient. Though a little dated, the rooms were fine. Comfortable, clean and enough space. Overall, this hotel was fine. For Canadian travellers, the Coast Gateway is an opportunity to support a Canadian company.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline overrated this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: asianphilosopher
Reviews.Content: This hotel was selected by virtue of using PRICELINE[-]. I only stayed here one night with my girlfriend at the tail-end of a trip which included Vancouver, B.C., Canada and Seattle, USA. Our stay was on July 31, 2005. My experiences with Priceline[-] have been mixed. When selecting a "4-star" hotel, the quality has been quite good; however, results for 3-star hotels vary considerably. I used Priceline[-] in the USA and was booked into the 4-star Hyatt Regency in Dallas for $70 USD. Great deal. I used Priceline[-] to book while I was in Vancouver, Canada and obtained a price of $75 USD for the Hyatt Regency (good price). These previous bookings on Priceline were for 4-star hotels. For the TWO recent occasions when I booked with Priceline[-] for 3-star hotels, they have both been disappointments. Like several other reviewers of THIS particular hotel (Seattle Coast Gateway Hotel by the SeaTac Airport), phone calls to the hotel to make requests such as my preference to stay in a non-smoking room were treated rudely and no ATTEMPT at accommodation was made. They said disparaging things about Priceline[-] and were basically saying "you get what you pay for" (which to the hotel staff means "bad service for low price"). When the front staff noted that my reservation was based on Priceline[-] prices, they were very curt, rude, and unhelpful. They said that they cannot take ANY requests if I booked on Priceline. Frankly speaking, I ended up paying a few dollars more than their regular rate on Priceline[-] based on their "bidding" process. I recall paying about $90 USD for a one-night stay. Considering this, they still were very unhelpful and rude. You may want to also check out my COMPREHENSIVE TripAdvisor review for the Crowne Plaza Hotel Georgia in Vancouver, B.C., Canada. A similarly poor experience resulted from the front desk seeing a Priceline[-] reservation. You can read my review directly by copy & pasting this URL: http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g154943-d181923-r3816695-Crowne_Plaza_Hotel_Georgia-Vancouver_British_Columbia.html The room quality was more like a cheap motel you see traveling through the middle-of-nowhere in rural areas. The mattress quality was very bad. It was not firm or supportive. I suspect the mattress coils were worn out and the bed needed replacement. The quality of the bed covers reminded me of the cheap blankets they hand out in economy-class airlines if you are taking an evening flight. They were neither warm nor comfortable. The "bathroom" was fairly interesting as well. The sink was not located in the bathroom. It was located just off the bedroom area. The toilet and shower were in the same (very small) room. While the shower was of the "shower in bathtub" variety, it was barely even a "half-tub". The shower area was very minimal. We literally stayed in the hotel no more than 5 hours that evening as we had to make it back to Vancouver, Canada to make a 7:45 a.m. flight... so we had to leave at 3 a.m. The hotel had no room service at that hour so we had to walk down the street to a 24-hour Denny's Restaurant. While the location of the hotel may be conveniently located close to the airport, the quality of this hotel negated this "benefit". I noted that there was a nice "Doubletree Hotel" across the street from this hotel. It looked much nicer. That hotel name is: Doubletree Hotel Seattle Airport. The downside of booking on Priceline[-] is that you cannot get a refund after your booking is confirmed... otherwise I would have gotten OUT of this hotel! At any rate, while I cannot say that I got to enjoy all the hotel amenities (if there were any) because of the short-nature of our stay, the service we received on the phone before our arrival combined with the very low-quality (1 or 2 star) quality room... makes it necessary to highly UN-RECOMMEND this hotel. STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL. You are warned. Kudos & admiration to a previous reviewer of this hotel who choked up the cost and decided to stay elsewhere despite losing his money because of the poor phone service he received prior to his anticipated stay. If booking on Priceline[-], beware of "3-star" rated hotels. You probably should try bidding on a 4-star hotel and cross your fingers for a good price. 3-star hotels do NOT seem to treat Priceline customers very well. Thanks for listening and I hope you heed my warnings. AVOID THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet stay right near the airport”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel for $75 on priceline and was pretty happy. We stayed there the night before an early flight after a long west coast vacation. I was surprised at how quiet it was- I never heard a plane take off and it's right across the street from the airport. The bed was extremely comfortable. Aside from a few nicks and dings on the furniture and a small bathroom with no air vent, it was a pretty standard 3 star property. One drawback though is the no pool or hot tub - it would have been nice! Free breakfast with belgian waffles was very tasty!

Reviews.Title: “If using priceline to book, beware!”
Reviews.Author: Teamsters117
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed here (nor will I) so my review is limited to the phone calls I endured while trying to work with the hotel desk after getting a priceline room. Their policy according to the front desk is that they will not work with you at all for any arrangements if you use priceline. After using priceline on many occassions, I have always asked for non-smoking rooms and two beds. Even though I know it is not guaranteed, every hotel has always been pleasant and accommodating, until this one. My first call I was lied to and told there were no rooms available for the night we were to stay and we would get what we get. After checking online and reserving the room I wanted I emailed the company asking if there was a better way to handle this. I received no response. On my second call directly to the hotel, I again was informed that there were no other rooms available and that they would not accommodate priceline customers. The next day I called to see if the reservation I made online could be swapped for the priceline room (I would keep the reservation and then cancel upon arrival). The response was more than rude, I was informed that they were definately not full for the night we were to stay but under no curcumstances would they let us have a non-smoking room with two beds. I have since decided to eat the $65 I paid to priceline and book at another hotel that treated us right when we've stayed before-- like the Hilton (service was amazing). Unfortunately the Coast Gateway will get my money for a night I didn't stay but some things are based on principle. Just be careful.

Reviews.Title: “I did not love it”
Reviews.Author: erinb007
Reviews.Content: I got this room for $75.00 on priceline, they listed it as 3star or above. I thought it was gross. The room, although clean, was very run down, stains on carpets, AC didn't work and the worst thing of all was that the mattress pad and linens didn't fit the bed. I kept waking up on the mattress...YUCK. The one redeeming factor is an excellent free continental bfast.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and old”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Based on the positive reviews, I booked a stay for a short weekend trip at the Coast Gateway Hotel. I am usually not disappointed with tripadvisor reviews. This is one of the few exceptions. I do not recommend this hotel. I agree that the lobby, dining room, and hallways are pleasant and clean. The breakfast is adequate (enjoyable "make your own waffle"). However, the room I stayed in was old and noisy (expect 5-6 am wake up calls from dump-trucks). There were cracks in the sink. The cramp bathroom had a shower door that swung outward causing the bathroom floor to get thoroughly wet every time you exit the shower. Because of this, the tiled floor was discolored with mildew. I do not know if the managing staff feels that the customers are just the "fly-in/fly-out" kinds, and do not feel that there is a need to obtain customer loyalty. Oh well, I am flying into Seatac again next week and will try my luck at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sea Tac location in March 2005.This Hotel exceeded my expectations. There was no airplane noise, the breakfast buffet was ample, I loved the business center, the room smelled good and was clean, the staff was so accomodating. I asked for late checkout and it was not a problem. The decor was pleasing...I would recommed it to anyone!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and It's Looking Good!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Lots of improvements under way and this hotel is really looking great! The lobby and dining area are nicely appointed and comfortable. Friendly and helpful staff have made our stays most enjoyable. We find this an excellent value and recommend this property to all our island friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great park & fly specials”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Coast Gateway is my choice for park, sleep & fly at Seatac. They frequently have a $99 special that includes a 1-night stay and 7 days parking. Although the parking is off-site, it is with the best parking facility in the area. Additionally, if you are an Alaska Airlines mileage participant, you can earn 500 points for each night you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fastastic Value and convenient to airport.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This reasonably priced hotel was the surprize of our trip. The hotel is located less than a block from SEA-TAC an has 24 hour shuttle. Coast appears to have undergone a recent remodel, and the did an excellent job. Located on International Blvd and next to the airport I was surprized to find that neither the street noise nor air-traffic were loud. Several nearby restuarants, and the hotel had a very good free breakfast.

HotelInfo.Name: Coast Gateway Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 18415 International Boulevard, Seattle, WA 98188
